provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Fishing Indushy (Consewation
of Conch (Genus Sirombus)) Regulations, 2000.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The persons named in the Schedule are, subject to such terms and                        Schedule.
conditions (if any) as are specified in the said Schedule, hereby exempt from
the requirements of section 3 (1) of the Act.
                                        SCHEDULE                              (Paragraph 2)
              Persons                          Terms and Conditions
   Every child under the age of
     sixteen     ...         ...          If accompanied by the holder of a valid
                                            licence issued pursuant to section 5 of the
                                            Act.
  Any-
    (a) visiting consultant;
    (b) employee of a foreign
         or international agency
  on attachment to the Fisheries
  Division of the Ministry of
  Agriculture ...           ...  If accompanied by-
                                   (a) an officer of the Fisheries Division
                                       of the Ministry of Agriculture who
                                       is the holder of a valid licence issued
                                       pursuant to section 5 of the Act; or
                                   (b) an off~cerof the Fisheries Division
                                       of the Ministry of Agriculture to
                                       whom an exemption has been
                                       granted under section 3 (2) of the Act.
                  [The inclusion of this page i s authorized by L.N. 78RW21
                                 FISHING INDUSTRY
                      THE FISHING INDUSTRY ACT
                                      ORDER
                                 (under section 19)
              (Made by the Minister on the 20th day of July, 1987)               LN   123~7

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. A distance of five hundred miles beyond the temtorial sea of Jamaica
shall be the area in which no person shall, using any of the methods specified
in the Schedule to the Act, engage in fishing unless he is the holder of a valid
licence issued pursuant to section 5 of the Act.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4 . 4 1 ) Any person wishing to obtain a licence to fish shall apply to the
Licensing Authority in the form set out as Foim A in the First Schedule.           First Schedule
                                                                                   Form A.
          (2) A licence to fish granted by the Licensing Authority pursuant to
section 5 (1) of the Act shall be in the form set out as Form B in the First F O ~ B
Schedule.
        (3) A temporary licence to fish granted by the Licensing Authority
pysuant to section 5 (3) of the Act shall be in the form set out as Form C in FormC
the First Schedule.
        (4) A fee of one dollar shall be payable to the Licensing Authority in
respect of a temporary licence to fish granted by the Licensing Authority.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5.+1) Every licensed fishermanand every person in charge of a
commercial wld storage facility, hotel or eating establishment which offers
conch meat to its patrons, shall, in writmg, declare to the Licensing Authority
the level of processing and quantity of conch me+ in their possession.
         (2) A licensed fisherman shall give to the Licensing Authority the
information required under paragraph (1) at least seven days prior to the
commencement of each close season for wnch.
         (3) Subjea to paragraph (4), a person in charge of a wmmercial
wld storage facility, hotel or eating establishment shall give to the Licensing
Authority the informalion required under that paragraph within seven days of
the wmmencement of each close season for conch.
.LN. 13811004
                   [m imluion of this prgr is authorized by L.N. IR006]
     THE FISHING INDUSTRY (CONSERVATlON OF CONCH (GENUS STROMBUS) )
                            REGULATIONS. 2000
        (4) A person in charge. of a commercial cold storage facility shall, in
addition to the information required to be given pursuant to paragraph (I), make
further declarations to the Licensing Authority of-
    (a) the name, address and such other particulars as the Licensing Authority
        may require from time to time, which identify the persons for whom
        the conch meat is stored; and
    (b) the quantity and level of processing of any additional conch meat that
        he receives for storage in his facility during the close season for conch.
         (5) Declarations in relation to the information specified in paragraph
(4) (b) shall be made within seventy-two hours of the receipt of the conch meat.
      (6) A declaration as to the level of processing of conch meat shall specify
whether the conch is-
    (a) 50% cleaned;
    (b) 65% processed;
    (c) 85% processed;
    ( 4 100% processed fillet;
    (e) ground conch;
    V) of any other category specified by the Licensing Authority.
        (7) The conversion factor used in ascertaining the level of processing
shall be as specified in the Second Schedule.                                  ~eo~nd
                                                                                     Schcdulc

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.--(I) Subject to paragraph (2), no person shall sell, process or import
conch meat during the close season for conch.
        (2) Notwithstanding paragraph (I), where conch meat has been declared
under regulation 5 to be in storage, that conch meat may be sold or processed
during the first twenty-one days of the close season for conch.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. A Fishery Inspector may at any reasonable time of day enter any processing
plant, commercial cold storage facility, hotel or eating establishment or any
other place in which conch meat is stored for the purpose of sale (hereinafter
referred to as "prescribed premises") and may-
    (a) inspect the prescribed premises;
    ( 6 ) examine any conch meat found thereon;
    (c) determine whether the Individual Conch Quota has been exceeded by
        any licensed fisherman;
    ( 4 remove any conch meat that is found thereon, of which the Licensing
        Authority has not been informed pursuant to regulation 5; and
                  (Tho inclwion of this page i s authorized by L.N.78R0021
                THE FISHING INDUSTRY (CONSERVATION OF CONCH (GENUS STROMBUS) )
                                       REGULATIONS, 2000
               (e) take, where he considers it appropriate, such other steps as may be
                     deemed necessary to prevent the sale of conch meat therefrom.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8 . 4 1 ) A Fishery Inspector may, where he has reasonable grounds for
           suspecting that any offence against these Regulations is being committed or is
           about to be committed on any prescribed premises-
               (a) enter, and remain upon such premises;
               (b) request any person in charge of or employed in such premises to furnish
                   such information as the Fishery Inspector may require for the purposes
                   of these ReguIations; and
                (c) give such directions as he considers necessary to prevent the commission
                    or further commission of an offence against these Regulations.
                   (2) Any person who-
                (a) refuses, neglects or fails to comply with any direction given to him by
                    any Fishery Inspector; or
                (b) refuses, without reasonable cause, to give any explanation which he is
                    required by any Fishery Inspector to give; or
                (c) assaults or obstructs any Fishery Inspector acting in the execution of
                    his duty,
           is guilty of an offence and is liable on summary conviction thereof before a
           Resident Magistrate to a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars and, in default
           of payment, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding twelve months.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. Every application by a registered owner of a fishing boat, for a licerice
                for such boat to be used for fishing pursuant to section 11 (1) of the Act, shalllbe
                made in the form set out as Form F in the First Schedule.                         I
                                                                                                  I
                    1 0 . 4 1 ) The registration marks of every registered boat shall-            I
                     (a) consist of a port identification mark followed immediately by the re&
                           tration number of the registered boat;
                     (6) be made of red or orange luminous paint upon a white or black back-                                   0
                         ground;
                     (c) be displayed by the registered boat in such manner as is prescribed in
                                                                                                      I
                         paragraphs (21, (31, (4) and (5).                                            I
                        (2) Where a registered boat is a non-decked canoe, the registr&tion
                marks of such boat shall be 20.23 centimetres (8 inches) in height and i2.54
                centimetres (1 inch) in width, displayed on both sides of the bow.        1
                                    --          -
                                                                                                  I
                                                                                                  I
                                                                                                  I
                                                                                                 I
                     THE FISHING INDUSTRY REGULATIONS, 1976                            7
          (3) Where a registered boat is a decked canoe, the registration marks
of such boat shall be 20.23 centimetres (8 inches) in height and 2.54 centimetres
(1 inch) in width, displayed on both sides of the bow and on the deck.
          (4) Where a registered boat is a fully decked vessel, the registration
marks of such boat shall be 30.5'centimetres (12 inches) in height and 3.8
                                                                                       -
centimetres (I'% inches) in width, displayed on both sides of the bow and on top
of the wheelhouse.
          (5) Where a registered boat is a yacht, the registration marks of such
boat shall be 30.5 centimetres (12 inches) in hei&t and 3.8 centimetres (1%
inches) in width, displayed on both sides of the bow and on both sides of the
mainsail.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. No person shall fish, collect, offer for sale or sell immature conch.
            * 11. The Minister may at any time, by Order-
               (a) implement measures to conserve and manage the fishing of conch in
                   any Fishery Management Area; and
                (6) prohibit fishing of conch in any Fishery Management Area for a
                    specified period of time.

provisions.title: Section 11
Section 12
provisions.content:
12. No person shall fish in a Fishery Management Area unless the Minister
           has declared that fishing may be allowed in that Area at that time.
              1 3 . 4 1) Every licensed fisherman shall, using the relevant form specified in
Th~rd      the Third Schedule, declare to the Licensing Authority, such information in
Schedule
           respect of each catch conducted.
                L.N. 37Bl2000
                                [The inclusion of this page is aurhorned b y L N 78/2002]
    THE FISHING INDUSTRY (CONSERVATION OF CONCH (GENUS STROMBUS) )
                           REGULATIONS, 2000
        (2) Every person in charge of a processing plant shall declare to the
Licensing Authority such information as is required using the relevant form
specified in the Third Schedule.                                              Third
                                                                                                 Schdule.
       (3) The information received by the Licensing Authority pursuant to
paragraphs (1) and (2) shall be used for the purposes of Fisheries Statistics.
        (4) Any person who refuses, neglects or fails to comply with paragraph
(I) or (2) is guilty of an offence and is liable on summary conviction before a
Resident Magistrate to a fine not exceeding one thousand dollars or to
imprisonment for a term not exceeding three months, or to both such fine and
imprisonment.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13.-(1) An appeal against a decision of the Licensing Authority, pursuant
to section 16 of the Act, shall be made in writing to the Minister..
         (2) Such appeal shall be commenced by a notice of appeal delivered to
the Minister.
         (3) A notice of appeal shall include-
     (a) the name, address and nationality of the appellant;
     (b) particulars of the decision of the Licensing Authority against which the
         appeal is made;
     (c) the grounds of appeal.
        (4) On a notice of appeal being delivered to the Minister, the appellant
may include any document, information, or correspondence, relevant to the ap-
peal, which in the opinion of the appellant is likely to assist the Minister in
coming to a decision on the appeal against the decision of the Licknsing Autho-
rity.
                                                                   -4
                      inclusion of this page is authorized by LN. 9SR013]
                    THE FISHING INDUSTRY REGULATIONS. 1976
                                                                                                                        i
         (5) The Minister may request that the appellant deliver to him any I
document, information, or correspondence, relevant to the appeal, which in the                                          I
opinion of the Minister is likely to assist him in coming to a decision on the
appeal against the decision of the Licensing Authority.
                                                                                                                        I
                                                                                                                        I
          (6) Upon failure, within a reasonable time, to comply with a request                                      1
made by the Minister pursuant to paragraph (5), the Minister may proceed to
consider the appeal made to him by the appellant and may make such decision,                                        I
as he may think fit.                                                           I
                                                                                                                    I

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14. -( 1) No person shall-
                                                                                                                I
                                                                                                                    i
    (a) catch and bring ashore, or destroy, any berried lobster;                                                I
                                                                                                                I
    (6) catch and bring ashore, or destroy, any spiny lobster (panulirus argusj
        of carapace length of less than 7.62 centimetres (3 inches);          1
     (c) use for the purpose of fishing any f3y net, or any shove net, of a n j
         length exceeding 3.66 metres (I2 feet);                                                            I
     (4 construct a fish trap using any material including mesh wire or netI
         which is less that 3.81cm (1% inches) in size.                                                 I
                                                                                                        I
         (2) No person shall, for the purpose of any fishing, make use of any
                                                                                                        I
beach seine unless-
                                                                                                    I
                                                                                                    I
     (a) the mesh size of the bunt be 3.17 centimetres (1 % inches) or more wide
         upon the bunt being hlly stretched;
                                                                                                    I
     (b) the mesh size of the comers be 4.43 centimetres (1% inches) or m o p
         wide upon the comers being hlly stretched;
                                                                                                    I
     (c) the mesh size of the wings be 5.08 centimetres (2 inches) or more wide
                                                                             I
         upon the wings being hlly stretched.                                I
                                                                                                1
          (3) A person shall not, between the hours of 6:00 p.m. and-5:00 a.m.,
use for the purpose of harvesting fish, any impaling device including-
                                                                                            I
     (a) Hawaiian sling;                                                                    I
                                                                                        I
                                                                                        I
     (c) any other impaling device.
                                                                                    I
    IS. If any person shall contravene the provisions of regulation 14, he shall
be guilty of an offence and upon summary conviction before a Resident Magis-
trate be liable to a tine not exceeding five hundred dollars and in default thereof,
to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months.                                i
                                                                                I
                     inclusion of thii page is authorized by LN. 9SR013]
